summary: The Department of Education broadly defines restraint as restricting a student’s ability to move their torso, arms, legs, or head freely, and seclusion as confining a student alone in an area they may not leave. Education has said these practices should never be used except when a child’s behavior poses imminent danger. title: K-12 Education: Federal Data and Resources on Restraint and Seclusion
